events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their personal vehicle and another car at a busy intersection, causing extensive front-end damage.
The claim was categorized as an auto accident based on the description of the incident and reported vehicle damages.
An agent was assigned to the case to guide the customer through the claim process and handle all communications.
Acknowledgment of the claim was sent to the customer, confirming receipt and outlining the next steps in the investigation.
The customer was requested to submit photos of the vehicle damage and a copy of the police accident report to support the claim.
The customer uploaded all requested documents, including detailed photographs and the official police report, facilitating the review.
The investigation team began assessing the claim, verifying the facts and evaluating the extent of damages reported.
Investigation completed with validation of damages and liability, confirming the customer's claim aligns with the police report.
A settlement amount was proposed based on repair cost estimates, covering all damages and related expenses from the accident.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the timely updates provided during the process.
The claim was officially approved by the claims department, authorizing the release of funds to cover the vehicle repairs.
Payment was issued promptly to the customerâ€™s designated repair shop to ensure timely commencement of necessary vehicle repairs.
After confirmation that repairs were completed successfully, the claim was closed and the customer received a closure notification.
